snippet: Politicians should be as responsible in the face of tragedy as a new group studying emergency responses to mass shootings.
abstract: Editorial praises Hartford Consensus, medical study group formed in wake of Newton, Conn, gun massacre that seeks to improve emergency care following similar tragedies; urges American politicians, including those in Connecticut, to emulate group's sense of responsibility and stop evading pressing need for increased gun safety.
lead_paragraph: Politicians should be as responsible in the face of tragedy as a new group studying emergency responses to mass shootings.
